records.data:
Moonshot AI's Kimi K2 Model Achieves Coding Benchmark SOTA: Moonshot AI released Kimi K2, a 32B parameter open-weight Mixture-of-Experts model, optimized for coding and tool use. Kimi K2 achieves state-of-the-art open-source performance on coding benchmarks like SWE-Bench Verified and Tau2, rivaling proprietary models like GPT-4.1 and Claude Opus, and is available via API or for self-hosting.

OpenAI Launches ChatGPT Agent with Virtual Computer: OpenAI launched ChatGPT Agent, a general-purpose agentic system capable of automating tasks by browsing the web, using a terminal, writing code, analyzing data, and creating reports, spreadsheets, and slides, running within its own sandboxed virtual machine. The Agent integrates Deep Research, Operator, and ChatGPT, and is rolling out to Pro, Plus, and Team users with usage limitations. 

Anthropic Introduces Claude for Finance Tool: Anthropic launched Claude for Finance, enabling users to analyze market data, create financial models, and perform research workflows. This new tool aims to streamline financial analysis using Claude's existing AI capabilities, but with a specific focus on the financial sector.

Mistral Releases Open-Source Voxtral Speech Model: Mistral AI released Voxtral, an open-source speech model designed for transcribing speech and allowing users to query the data using natural language, outperforming Gemini in transcription tasks according to internal benchmarks. Voxtral comes in two sizes—a 24B variant for production-scale applications and a 3B variant for local and edge deployments—both models are derived from Mistral Small 3 and released under the Apache 2.0 license.

Google DeepMind Releases Veo 3 Video Generation Model: Google DeepMind announced that Veo 3, their latest video generation model, is now available in public preview through the Gemini API and AI Studio. The model allows for generating videos from complex prompts and is being integrated into AI Mode in Google Search.

Cognition Acquires Windsurf for Devin AI Integration: Cognition, the company behind the Devin AI agent, acquired Windsurf, a company providing an IDE tech and AI assistant (Cascade AI assistant) for improved task delegation. Cognition plans to integrate Windsurf's IDE into Devin, enhancing Devin's capabilities.

Manus AI Introduces Visual Analytics Tool for Spreadsheets: Manus AI introduced a visual analytics tool designed to automate the creation of dashboards, reports, and meeting preparation workflows directly from spreadsheets. This tool is designed to streamline data visualization and analysis, enhancing productivity for users working with spreadsheet data.

Lovable Raises $200M for AI App-Building Platform at $1.8B Valuation: Lovable, an AI agent startup, raised $200 million in Series A funding, achieving a valuation of $1.8 billion, to further develop its AI-powered platform for quickly creating and deploying micro apps. Lovable allows non-developers to create apps and sites using natural language prompts.

Perplexity AI Partners with Airtel India: Perplexity AI partnered with Airtel India to offer Perplexity Pro subscriptions to Airtel's 360 million customers. This partnership allows Airtel users in India to access Perplexity Pro and it led to Perplexity becoming the top app in the Indian App Store.

Decart AI releases MirageLSD, enabling real-time video diffusion: Decart AI unveiled MirageLSD, a new model capable of real-time video diffusion. This technology enables capabilities like creating alternate realities in video feeds, real-time movie direction, and styling game environments with text prompts.

Mistral AI Releases Voxtral Speech Recognition Models: Mistral AI launched Voxtral, a family of open speech recognition models, claiming they are the world's best. The models can be accessed via API, on Le Chat, or downloaded from Hugging Face.

Moonshot AI's Kimi K2 Open Model Challenges Proprietary Models: Moonshot AI's Kimi K2, a trillion-parameter Mixture-of-Experts (MoE) model, is live on W&B Inference via CoreWeave and available in the LM Arena. Demonstrations show Kimi K2 running on Groq achieving speeds of 200 tokens/second, and benchmarks indicate it outperformed GPT-4.1 on SWE-Bench Verified.

Nous Research Open-Sources Hermes 3 Dataset: Nous Research released the Hermes 3 dataset, containing 1 million samples used to create SOTA models on the Llama-3 series. The dataset includes data for system prompt adherence, roleplay, tool calling, and proto-agentic reasoning.

LangChain Releases Open Deep Research Agent: LangChain open-sourced Open Deep Research, an agent built on LangGraph using a supervisor architecture to coordinate sub-agents for complex research tasks. The release includes a blog, video overview, and runnable code.

Runway Unveils Act Two for Motion Capture: Runway introduced Act Two, a new model that generates expressive character motion from video performances. Demonstrations showcased transformations of people into dancing ancient Greek statues and orcs from LOTR.

Reflection AI Launches Asimov for Code Understanding: Reflection AI announced Asimov, a tool designed to help engineers understand codebases. This addresses the problem that engineers spend 70% of their time understanding code, not writing it.

LlamaIndex and UiPath Announce Integration: LlamaIndex announced an extensive integration with UiPath, allowing developers to build custom agents with LlamaIndex's workflow tools within UiPath's enterprise automation platform. This enables the creation of custom agents within an enterprise automation setting.

Cloudflare Launches 'Pay Per Crawl' to Monetize Content for AI Bots: Cloudflare launched "Pay Per Crawl," allowing publishers and e-commerce sites to charge AI bots for accessing their content. This feature offers a new avenue for content monetization as AI-driven search tools increasingly rely on web crawling.

Lightricks Releases LTXV Video Generation Model: Lightricks released LTXV, an open-source video generation model from Lightricks, claiming to be the first to enable native long-form (30-60+ second) AI video with strong prompt-based and control LoRA support. The model runs on consumer GPUs and supports multi-prompt story direction and control net features.

Meta Hires Jason Wei and Hyung Won Chung from OpenAI for Meta Superintelligence: Meta recruited Jason Wei and Hyung Won Chung, noted co-creators of GPT-4 and the 'o-series' at OpenAI, to lead efforts at Meta Superintelligence. This move aims to scale Meta's AI research and compete with OpenAI on frontier LLM development.

Mistral Releases Voxtral Speech Recognition Model: Mistral AI has launched Voxtral, an open-source speech recognition model, available in 3B and 24B parameter sizes. Voxtral supports long context, built-in Q&A and summarization, multilingual capabilities, and function calling straight from voice. It outperforms OpenAI's Whisper large-v3 in transcription tasks.

Moonshot AI's Kimi K2 Model Challenges Western Models: Moonshot AI released Kimi K2, a non-reasoning Mixture of Experts (MoE) model, that is challenging western models. Kimi K2's rapid inference speed on Groq's hardware makes it immediately more compelling than Sonnet 4. Kimi K2 offers up to 500k tokens per day for free use.

xAI Launches Grok Avatars and Companions: xAI has released Grok avatars and companions. The feature allows users to select AI personas for their Grok chatbot.

RunwayML Introduces Act-Two Motion Capture Model: RunwayML launched Act-Two, a next-generation motion capture model. The model offers major improvements in generation quality and supports hands.

Google Enhances Gemini with Embeddings and Photo-to-Video Feature: Google DeepMind announced that its Gemini Embedding model is generally available and ranks #1 on the MTEB leaderboard. They also shared a Gemini feature that can turn photos into videos with sound.

Thinking Machines Lab Valued at $12 Billion After Funding Round: Mira Murati's AI startup, Thinking Machines Lab, raised $2 billion in funding. The company is now valued at $12 billion before releasing any product, and will use the money for a large computer cluster expected to be ready by 2026.

Google Discover Adds AI Summaries: Google has started showing short AI-written summaries above some links in the Discover feed.  Early tests show fewer people tap the link when a summary is shown.

Microsoft Introduces Copilot Vision Screen Reading to Windows: Microsoft is adding a feature to Windows that allows users to draw a box around anything on their screen and have Copilot read it, translate it, or write a summary. The feature keeps data inside the company’s secure cloud.

Anthropic Releases Claude for Financial Services: Anthropic released Claude for Financial Services to combine external market data with internal firm data for financial analysis.  Claude Code handles tasks like Monte Carlo simulations and proprietary trading model building, with expanded usage limits for analysts.

Perplexity AI's New AI Browser: Perplexity AI's new AI browser Comet embeds their search engine alongside an AI assistant capable of performing agentic tasks. The AI can summarize long email threads, schedule meetings, and manage calendar events.

Pentagon Invests in Agentic AI Development with Multiple Firms: The Pentagon's Chief Digital & AI Office is distributing $200 million each to Anthropic, Google, and xAI, in addition to a similar agreement with OpenAI, to expedite the development and deployment of agentic AI technologies for battlefield applications. This aims to cultivate a domestic oligopoly of AI model providers, ensuring talent and computational resources remain within the U.S. while demanding adherence to DoD standards for safety, auditability, and interoperability.

Meta to Activate Massive Data Centers for AI Superintelligence: Meta plans to launch its Prometheus data center in Ohio next year, followed by Hyperion in Louisiana, both providing multi-gigawatt capacity rivaling small nuclear plants. These facilities are designed to support the company's next-generation “super-intelligence” models, signaling a shift towards giga-campuses to meet the growing computational demands of AI development and deployment.

Xiaomi Automates EV Production with Advanced Robotics: Xiaomi is challenging Tesla in the Chinese EV market by deploying a highly automated factory employing 1,000 robots. Their manufacturing strategy includes replacing complex, multi-part processes with single die-cast elements, allowing for rapid production and positioning Xiaomi to offer competitive pricing.

Synopsys' Acquisition of Ansys Approved, Consolidating Chip Design Software Market: China approved Synopsys's $35 billion acquisition of Ansys, marking the largest deal in electronic design automation.  This deal means that nearly the entire global market for high-end chip design software will be controlled by two U.S. companies, concentrating supply chains and increasing dependence on fewer tool providers.

Meta Considers Closed-Source Strategy for Superintelligence Lab: Meta's superintelligence lab is considering abandoning its open-source model, Behemoth, in favor of a closed alternative.  This shift suggests that China may now lead in open-weight AI frontier, signaling a change in Meta's previous commitment to openness in AI development.

Genspark Pivots to AI Agents, Experiences Rapid Growth: Genspark, initially recognized as a search engine, shifted its focus to AI agents, leading to significant revenue growth.  The company, founded by former Baidu executives, reportedly grew its ARR to $36 million in approximately 45 days, fueled by its 'Super agent' and constant feature updates, achieving this growth with only a 20-person team.

Cognition Acquires Windsurf After Google Acquires Senior Leadership: Cognition, the company behind the Devin AI developer tool, acquired what remained of video-AI startup Windsurf, including its IP, talent, product, and brand. This acquisition occurred after Google hired Windsurf's senior leadership team for $2.4B, with Cognition founder mentioning Windsurf as an $82M business.

Moonshot AI's Kimi K2 Model Challenges US Dominance: Moonshot AI, a Chinese lab, is releasing Kimi K2, a 1T parameter MoE model, which rivals Claude Sonnet 4 and Opus 4 in creative writing, coding, and tool calling. This model is significantly cheaper to train, potentially costing around $5 million, and is already being served at superfast speeds by Groq.

Grok Introduces AI Companions with Animated Avatars: Grok, in partnership with Anichat, has launched 'Companions', featuring red panda and anime character avatars powered by Grok dialogue and Anichat generative animation for dialogue.  One avatar, Ani, has a borderline NSFW character, and the company Meta acquired a similar company that used to clone AI voices, suggesting similar functionaly may soon be added.

Mirai Launches On-Device AI SDK for iOS & macOS: Mirai introduced an on-device AI SDK for iOS and macOS, enabling developers to ship Llama-3, Qwen-3, Gemma-3, or DeepSeek-R1 models locally with zero latency, cloud costs, and privacy concerns. The SDK includes a Swift engine, model-conversion toolkit, and allows for integration of custom models.

Ambience Healthcare's AI Scribe Achieves Medical Coding Accuracy Improvement: Ambience Healthcare's AI scribe, utilizing OpenAI's Reinforcement Fine-Tuning, achieved a 12% improvement in ICD-10 medical coding accuracy compared to human doctors, demonstrating the potential to significantly reduce administrative burdens in healthcare. Cleveland Clinic reported a 75% voluntary utilization rate of the Ambience Scribe across 4,000 physicians after requiring them to use it just once, highlighting the tool's user acceptance and reliability.

Moonshot AI's Kimi K2 Outperforms Proprietary Models in Agentic Tasks: Moonshot AI released Kimi K2, a 1 trillion-parameter open-source model, surpassing closed-model proprietary systems like GPT-4.1 on coding and math tests and setting a new standard for open-weight Agentic AI. The Kimi K2 model scores 65.8% on SWE-bench Verified, which involves fixing real GitHub bugs, exceeding GPT-4.1 by 11 points and DeepSeek V3 by 27 points.

Amazon Invests in Anthropic's Claude, Boosting AWS Growth: Amazon's investment in Anthropic's Claude is generating billions for AWS, making it a top-five cloud customer, with the equity stake also providing cost-based model training credits for Amazon in the future. This investment is an example of how Amazon is nurturing AI vendors early, resulting in significant cloud revenue growth.

Google DeepMind Releases GenAI Processors for Faster Content Transformation: Google DeepMind released GenAI Processors, an open-source library designed to parallelize token-level content transformations across CPUs or GPUs, enhancing the efficiency of generative AI tasks. Benchmarks indicate up to 8x speed improvements in prompt-engineering loops and batch-image generation with GenAI Processors, allowing developers to run heavier workloads on cheaper instances.

Tesla Shareholders Approve Funding for xAI Integration: Tesla's shareholders approved Elon Musk’s plan to invest up to $10 billion in xAI, allowing Tesla to leverage real-time vehicle data for Grok and prioritize access to xAI’s supercomputer clusters. This partnership could give Tesla an advantage in autonomous driving insights through early integration.

Goldman Sachs Piloting Cognition's Devin AI for Autonomous Coding: Goldman Sachs is piloting Cognition's Devin AI agent as an autonomous coder, marking a significant AI milestone for Wall Street and potentially reducing the need for junior developers. Goldman Sachs plans to deploy hundreds of Devin AI instances to autonomously manage engineering workflows, rather than just assisting human developers.

Meta Acquires Voice Startup PlayAI for AI-Generated Voices: Meta acquired PlayAI, a startup specializing in AI-generated voice cloning and speech synthesis technology, indicating Meta's strategic focus on integrating realistic AI-generated voices into its AI companion and wearable device projects. PlayAI's technology will be integrated into Meta AI and AI Characters to create lifelike generative voice agents.

Cloud Kitchens Automates Food Assembly with Robotics: Travis Kalanick's Cloud Kitchens is rolling out fully robotic restaurants, featuring a 60-square-foot machine capable of assembling 300 custom bowls per hour to fundamentally rewire the economics of the restaurant industry. The robot's precision and efficiency are cutting labor costs for Cloud Kitchen's customers from 30% of revenue down to 7-10%.

Manus Relocates AI Agent Operations to Singapore Amid Chip Curbs: Manus, the company behind the popular general-purpose AI agent, has relocated operations from China to Singapore in order to gain access to global talent amid U.S. chip restrictions. The shift reflects challenges faced by Chinese companies in accessing advanced technology and attracting international expertise.

Guidde Leverages AI for Video Guide Creation: Guidde utilizes AI to quickly transform text into video guides, assisting users in easily creating editable video tutorials with AI-generated narrations and voiceovers across 100+ languages. The Guidde platform facilitates simple creation, and easy editing, and supports multiple languages.

xAI Launches Grok4 with Multi-Agent Architecture and New Subscription Tier: xAI released Grok4, claiming PhD-level performance and introducing a $300/month 'SuperGrok Heavy' tier. The 'Heavy' version employs multiple AI agents working simultaneously to solve problems, comparing results to find the best answers, demonstrating a multi-agent architecture approach to improve reasoning.

Perplexity Introduces Comet, an AI-Powered Web Browser: Perplexity launched Comet, its AI-powered web browser, pre-installing its AI search engine as the default. Comet Assistant, an AI agent in the sidebar, automates tasks like summarizing emails, managing tabs, and answering questions based on the viewed webpage, challenging traditional browsing paradigms.

Google Adds Image-to-Video to Veo 3 and Gemini to Wear OS: Google is expanding its AI integration by adding image-to-video generation to Veo 3 via the Gemini app and rolling out Gemini to Wear OS smartwatches. This enables users to transform photos into videos with audio descriptions and utilize Gemini for tasks across multiple apps directly from their wrist, replacing Google Assistant.

Google Hires Windsurf Team to Bolster DeepMind's Coding Efforts: Google hired Windsurf's CEO Varun Mohan and key researchers in a $2.4 billion deal to strengthen DeepMind's Gemini agentic coding efforts. This strategic move secures top coding talent, enhancing Google's competitiveness in building coding agents, after OpenAI's planned $3 billion acquisition fell through.

Microsoft Achieves $500M in AI-Driven Savings After Layoffs: Microsoft reported over $500 million in AI-driven savings across departments, shortly after laying off approximately 9,000 employees. This highlights the company's increased efficiency and cost reduction achieved through the implementation of AI technologies within its operations.

OpenAI Plans to Launch AI-Powered Web Browser: OpenAI is planning to release its own AI-centric web browser to compete with existing browsers like Chrome. The launch of this browser, which will likely incorporate ChatGPT functionalities, signals OpenAI's intent to expand beyond its current AI offerings and reshape web navigation.

xAI Releases Grok 4, Demonstrating Advanced Reasoning Capabilities: xAI launched Grok 4, showcasing enhanced reasoning and general knowledge abilities. Benchmarks indicated top performance over competitor models, though controversies arose when the X-integrated chatbot exhibited antisemitic behavior and aligned its responses with Elon Musk's opinions.

Hugging Face and Pollen Robotics Launch Reachy Mini, an Open-Source Robot: Hugging Face and Pollen Robotics released Reachy Mini, an open-source robot designed for human-robot interaction and AI experimentation. Available in two variants (Reachy Mini and Reachy Mini Lite), this expressive robot serves as a gateway for robotics and AI development in educational and creative contexts.

OpenAI to Partner with Jony Ive's io Products for AI Hardware: OpenAI has completed its acquisition of io Products Inc., the hardware startup co-founded by Jony Ive, for approximately $6.5 billion. Ive and his design firm LoveFrom will collaborate with OpenAI to develop an AI-first device, integrating AI capabilities into new hardware designs.

Microsoft Delays Next-Generation Maia AI Chip: Microsoft's next-generation Maia AI chip, codenamed Braga, is delayed until at least 2026 due to design changes, staffing shortages, and late feature requests from OpenAI. This delay raises concerns about Microsoft's ability to compete with Nvidia and means Azure cloud services will rely on Nvidia hardware for a longer period.

Moonshot AI Releases Kimi K2, a 1 Trillion Parameter Model: Moonshot AI launched Kimi K2, a 1 trillion parameter Mixture-of-Experts model with 32 billion active parameters, trained on 15.5 trillion tokens using the MuonClip optimizer; Kimi K2 demonstrates impressive benchmark performance in coding and agentic tasks, rivaling GPT-4.1 and Sonnet 4 on non-thinking tasks at a lower price point, making it a strong contender in the open-source LLM landscape. The model is released under a modified MIT license requiring attribution in commercial deployments with high usage.

xAI Releases Grok-4 with a New 'Heavy' Multi-Agent Mode: xAI released Grok-4, a model trained with 10x RL compute, claiming top performance on various frontier model benchmarks; Grok 4 is accompanied by Grok 4 Heavy, a new 'multi-agent version' offering increased performance, with a subscription priced at $300 per month and showcases search-heavy behavior similar to o3 pro. Despite boasting impressive benchmark results, Grok 4 has faced criticism for potential bias and questionable reliability stemming from the model's alignment with Elon Musk's views.

Google Hires Windsurf's CEO and Select Team Members Following Collapsed OpenAI Acquisition: Google DeepMind hired Windsurf CEO Diana Truong, co-founder Douglas Chen, and several R&D employees, focusing on agentic coding within Gemini, after OpenAI's acquisition of Windsurf fell through; Windsurf will shut down and open-source its code. This move allows Google to integrate Windsurf's video summarization technology into Vertex AI and strengthens its AI coding capabilities within the Gemini project.

Replit Launches 'Dynamic Intelligence' Upgrade for Replit Agent with Enhanced Capabilities: The new features can be toggled on a per-request basis, providing flexibility depending on the complexity of the task.

Perplexity Launches Comet, an AI-Powered Web Browser: Perplexity launched Comet, an AI-powered web browser featuring its AI search engine and Comet Assistant, an AI agent for automating routine tasks such as summarizing emails, managing tabs, and navigating web pages and could gain an advantage if a significant number of Perplexity users sign up for the product. Initially available to subscribers of Perplexity’s $200-per-month Max plan and a select group of invitees, Comet's key feature is Perplexity’s AI search engine, which is pre-installed and set as the default.

Meta Acquires Voice-AI Startup PlayAI for $225 Million: Meta acquired PlayAI, a voice-AI startup, for approximately $225 million in cash and stock, adding PlayAI's 40-person team, including ex-Apple Siri leaders, to its super-intelligence division under Yann LeCun. PlayAI develops low-latency voice-cloning tech and small speech-to-speech models for mobile devices, reinforcing Meta's roadmap in premium voice interfaces and potentially impacting API pricing strategies.

Hugging Face and Pollen Robotics Launch Reachy Mini Open-Source Robot: The robot has reached almost $500,000 in pre-orders.

Together AI Releases DeepSWE: A Fully Open-Source RL-Trained Coding Agent Based on Qwen3-32B: This is a shift towards creating adaptive language agents.

Promptriever and Rank1 Improve Information Retrieval with Instruction Following and Reasoning: Promptriever unlocks new query types.

Amazon Deploys One Millionth Robot and Releases Generative AI Model DeepFleet: This showcases generative AI for robotic operations.

xAI Launches Grok 4 with Multi-Agent Architecture and Image Support: xAI has released Grok 4, featuring a multi-agent architecture for synthesizing answers and 256k context window. The model includes image support and voice mode and is available immediately via API and a paid subscription. Grok 4 Heavy is available at a new $300/month tier, alongside reports of dominating benchmarks such as ARC-AGI.

Mistral AI Releases Devstral Small and Medium 2507 for Coding Tasks: Mistral AI, in collaboration with All Hands AI, released Devstral Small 1.1 and Devstral Medium 2507, models optimized for agentic coding tasks. Devstral Small 1.1, a 24B parameter model, is open-source under Apache 2.0 and supports function calling with a performance exceeding all other open models for code agents on the SWE-bench Verified (OpenHands scaffold) benchmark.

Perplexity AI Launches Comet Browser with Integrated AI Search: Perplexity AI launched Comet, a Chromium-based browser that integrates its AI search engine to offer direct, sourced answers. Initially available to Perplexity Max subscribers, Comet aims to provide a superior YouTube experience and enhance workflows with its agentic browser capabilities and is praised for its hybrid client-server architecture.

Liquid AI Releases LFM2 Series Optimized for On-Device Performance: Liquid AI open-sourced its second-generation Liquid Foundation Models (LFM2), optimized for on-device performance on CPUs. The LFM2 series includes 350M, 700M, and 1.2B parameter versions featuring multiplicative gates and short convolutions to achieve optimal inference speed, and the models are praised for transparency and ease of fine-tuning.

Microsoft Releases Phi-4-mini-flash-reasoning for Math Applications: Microsoft introduced Phi-4-mini-flash-reasoning, a 3.8B parameter model leveraging the SambaY architecture for improved long-context reasoning. Built on synthetic math tokens, it achieves notable improvements with linear prefiling time complexity, up to 10x higher throughput, enhanced scalability, and excels on benchmarks such as AIME24/25, Math500, and GPQA Diamond.

Hugging Face Releases Reachy Mini, an Open-Source Robot: Hugging Face released Reachy Mini, an open-source robot available in lite ($299) and full ($449) versions. This 11-inch robot can be programmed in Python and integrates with Hugging Face's AI models for speech, vision, and personality, with delivery starting late summer 2025.

AWS to Launch AI Agent Marketplace with Anthropic Partnership: Amazon Web Services (AWS) is set to launch an AI agent marketplace, partnering with Anthropic. This platform will allow startups to directly offer their AI agents to AWS customers, streaming AI agent distribution.

Google Enhances Gemini with Image-to-Video Generation and Firebase Integration: Google enhanced Gemini's multimodal capabilities by adding image-to-video generation via Veo 3 and making the feature available to Pro & Ultra subscribers. Additionally, Google enhanced Firebase Studio with three Gemini-powered AI modes: Ask, Agent, and Agent Auto-run to support developers with their projects.

Robinhood CEO Co-founds Harmonic AI, Raises $100M for Math Model: Vlad Tenev, CEO of Robinhood, co-founded Harmonic AI, which raised $100M in a Series B round to develop a model for solving complex math problems. The company's Aristotle model uses a special verification process to minimize hallucinations, and Harmonic plans to make its Aristotle model available later this year.

Knox Secures $6.5M to Streamline Federal Security Compliance: Knox, a company that helps software vendors navigate federal security compliance, raised $6.5M in funding. The company aims to speed up federal security compliance (FedRAMP) from 3 years to 3 months, so vendors can sell software to government agencies.

Anthropic Rolls Out Hooks in Claude Code for Agent Control: Anthropic introduced Hooks in Claude Code, enabling users to trigger specified actions during agent operation instead of relying solely on the LLM's discretion. These Hooks facilitate the construction of workflows for notifications, approvals, and permission verification by executing shell commands at critical agent lifecycle stages. The new feature allows for modification or blocking of Claude's actions through structured JSON, offering extensive control but posing security risks due to full user permission execution.

Cast AI Enables LLM Cost Reduction via Real-Time Scaling: Cast AI introduced an AI Enabler that dynamically scales large language models, potentially cutting LLM idle costs by up to 70%. The system supports models from OpenAI, Anthropic, and others, and uses zero-downtime hibernation and autoscaling to adapt to traffic spikes, requiring minimal manual configuration.

Google Releases Veo 3 Globally with Audio Generation for Gemini Pro Users: Google has globally launched Veo 3, an updated version of its video generation model, for Gemini Pro users. The new version allows Pro users to generate videos accompanied by sound.

Perplexity Launches Comet, an Agentic Browser: Perplexity has introduced Comet, an agentic web browser designed to enhance research, automate tasks, and streamline digital workflows. The browser, which embeds Perplexity's search engine, is initially available to Max subscribers with broader access planned in the future.

Sakana AI Introduces AB-MCTS for Collaborative AI Models: Sakana AI has unveiled AB-MCTS, a new approach that enables AI models to collaborate, combining strengths from models like ChatGPT, Gemini, and DeepSeek. The new method allows to build collaborative AI agents.

Replit Adds Dynamic Intelligence for Autonomous Web Search in Agent: Replit has integrated Dynamic Intelligence into its Agent, granting it the capability to autonomously debug, optimize, and perform web searches. This update enhances the agent's ability to handle complex tasks and improve code quality.

Together AI Releases Open-Source RL Coding Agent Based on Qwen3: Together AI has published an open-source tool based on Qwen3, facilitating the development of reinforcement learning (RL)-tuned coding agents. The tool is designed to enable developers to build and train agents that can autonomously generate and optimize code.

Hugging Face Launches Open-Source Robot 'Reachy Mini' Priced at $299: Hugging Face has introduced the Reachy Mini, an open-source desktop robot priced at $299, developed in collaboration with Pollen Robotics. The robot, designed for AI builders, is fully integrated with LeRobotHF and the Hugging Face ecosystem, and saw substantial pre-orders upon launch.

OpenAI to Release AI-Powered Web Browser and Open-Source Model: OpenAI is reportedly preparing to launch an AI-powered web browser and an open-source language model soon, signaling strategic initiatives. The browser is planned to challenge Google Chrome, while the model, similar to 'o3 mini,' will feature enhanced reasoning capabilities.

Walmart's AI App Factory Streamlines Retail Operations: Walmart's internally developed AI application platform, Element, is enabling the creation and deployment of various applications for retail store personnel, using Google Cloud, Microsoft Azure, and in-house data centers. Key applications include shift-planning, augmented reality-based item tracking (VizPick), and real-time language translation to improve communication and productivity in retail environments.

Hugging Face Releases Fully Open Source SmolLM3: Hugging Face released SmolLM3, a 3B-parameter language model under the Apache 2.0 license, supporting six languages with strong reasoning and long-context processing up to 128k tokens. It targets high performance in the small model segment and includes sliding-window attention and LoRA adapters for commercial use, enabling document-heavy chatbots without GPT-4-level costs.

NVIDIA Releases OpenCodeReasoning-Nemotron-1.1-32B Coding Model: Nvidia released OpenCodeReasoning-Nemotron-1.1-32B, a coding model trained on competitive programming questions and responses generated by DeepSeek-R1-0528. It is derived from Qwen2.5-32B-instruct, achieving competitive performance against leading Chinese models and ready for commercial and non-commercial use.

Mistral AI Reportedly in Talks to Raise $1 Billion: Mistral is reportedly negotiating a funding round of $1 billion, potentially valuing the company above $6 billion, to support the development of new large language models. The funding may include investments from Abu Dhabi's MGX fund and French lenders, and will help accelerate releases and enterprise support for its open-weight models like Mixtral.

Zoom Launches Video Calls on Meta Quest Headsets: Zoom launched a dedicated application for Meta Quest headsets, enabling users to join standard Zoom meetings within virtual reality. The app features shared screen viewing on a large floating display and supports interactions using hand tracking and Meta avatars, providing businesses with new collaboration options without additional fees.

Meta Invests $3.5 Billion in EssilorLuxottica for AI Smart Glasses: Meta invested $3.5 billion for a 3% stake in EssilorLuxottica, aiming to dominate the smart glasses market, with plans for next-gen Ray-Ban Meta glasses integrated with Meta AI.  This move provides Meta with direct influence on product development and access to EssilorLuxottica's retail network.

Meta Poaches Apple's AI Leader Ruoming Pang: Meta has hired Ruoming Pang, Apple's head of AI foundation models, to its Superintelligence Labs, reportedly with a compensation package in the tens of millions. Pang, who led a 100-person team at Apple, brings expertise in lightweight, on-device AI and signifies internal instability within Apple's AI division.

OpenAI Hires Engineering Talent from Tesla, xAI and Meta: OpenAI has recruited key engineering staff from Tesla, xAI, and Meta, including Tesla’s former VP of software and engineers who contributed to xAI’s Colossus supercomputer. This move aims to strengthen OpenAI's scaling team and bolster its infrastructure for developing next-generation AI models.

Replit Partners with Microsoft for Enterprise AI App Development: Replit is partnering with Microsoft to offer its vibe coding platform through Azure Marketplace, which was a major blow to previous partner Google Cloud.

Hugging Face Opens Orders for Reachy Mini Desktop Robot: Hugging Face launched Reachy Mini, a $299 desktop robot, designed to be used for integrating AI models into robotics. The robot is compact in size, is built to be wireless, has six degrees of freedom, is equipped with a camera, mics and animated antennas and compatible with the Hugging Face Hub.

Warp surpasses Claude Code on T-Bench: Warp just launched the first Agentic Development Environment and it has already surpassed Claude Code by over +20% on Terminal-Bench. It also scored 71% on SWE-bench Verified to make it the best-performing AI coding agent on the market and is capable of long running commands.

Meta Hires Apple's Head of AI Foundation Models: Meta has poached Ruoming Pang, who previously led Apple's foundation model efforts for iPhone features, to join Meta's Superintelligence team. This move occurs shortly after Meta recruited several OpenAI researchers, suggesting a targeted strategy to strengthen their AI talent pool and develop smaller frontier models for Quest headsets and smart glasses.

xAI Plans Livestream for Grok 4 Release: Elon Musk's xAI is set to unveil Grok 4 through a livestream event on Wednesday at 8 PM PT. This announcement signals an advancement in xAI's Grok model, potentially bringing improvements in performance and capabilities.

ChatGPT Tests 'Study Together' Feature: OpenAI is testing a new 'Study Together' mode within ChatGPT, which allows users to share notes, flashcards, and timed study sessions. The feature appears to be designed to offer a more interactive learning experience, including group chat and automatic quiz generation from shared documents, signaling OpenAI's move into collaborative learning spaces.

Google's Isomorphic Labs Progresses Towards Human Trials with AI-Designed Drugs: Isomorphic Labs, an Alphabet company, is preparing for its first human clinical trials involving AI-designed cancer drugs, aiming to eventually 'solve all diseases'.  The company secured $600M in funding in April, is utilizing DeepMind's AlphaFold 3 to predict protein structures and molecular interactions, revolutionizing drug discovery by integrating AI models with pharmaceutical expertise.

Huawei Denies Copying Alibaba's AI Model Amidst Accusations: Huawei's research arm is refuting claims that its new Pangu Pro model was derived from Alibaba's Qwen 2.5, after allegations emerged from whistleblowers highlighting similarities between the two. Huawei maintains that Pangu was developed independently using its Ascend chips, disputing the accusations of cloning third-party models.

Microsoft's BitNet Model Gets an Inference Framework on GitHub: An inference framework for Microsoft's BitNet b1.58, a 1.58-bit large language model designed for efficient and lossless CPU inference using optimized low-bit kernels, has been released on GitHub. This framework makes the BitNet model more accessible for developers looking to implement it.

CoreWeave Acquires Core Scientific to Expand AI Infrastructure: CoreWeave, an AI cloud infrastructure provider, is acquiring data center operator Core Scientific in a $9 billion all-stock deal. This acquisition aims to eliminate $10 billion in future lease obligations and grant CoreWeave ownership of 1.3 gigawatts of compute capacity, bolstering its ability to support AI workloads.

Together AI Releases DeepSWE Coding Agent: Together AI launched DeepSWE, an open-source, RL-trained coding agent based on Qwen3-32B, which achieves 59% on the SWEBench. This marks a notable advancement in AI-assisted code generation.

ByteDance Open-Sources Trae-Agent, a Developer Agent: ByteDance's Trae AI released Trae-Agent, their IDE agent and SWE-bench Verified #1 tool, on GitHub to foster an open agent ecosystem. The agent supports OpenAI and Anthropic keys and is adaptable for OpenRouter.

Runway Enables Video Game Generation with AI: Runway is enabling users to generate video games using AI. This will allow users to create game prototypes and interactive experiences more easily with AI, marking a significant expansion of AI applications in entertainment.

Cluely Raises $15 Million for Real-Time AI Assistant: Cluely, an AI startup, secured a $15 million investment from Andreessen Horowitz to develop a real-time AI assistant that provides users with relevant information and suggestions during meetings, sales calls, and interviews via an undetectable screen overlay, similar to Apple's "Liquid Glass" paradigm. The company envisions a future where humans are free to pursue intrinsic desires rather than being dictated by economic necessities, aiming for a positive impact on humanity through its technology.

H Company Open Sources Holo1 for Browser Automation: H Company, backed by a $220M seed round, open-sourced Holo1, the action model powering Surfer H, which is now the top-ranked web-browsing agent on WebVoyager. Holo1 allows users to automate multi-step browser workflows, integrating with RAG workflows and RPA suites, while also lowering costs to $0.11-$0.13 per run for browsing flows.

Cursor Faces Backlash Over Pricing Changes: AI coding platform Cursor quietly restructured its Pro plan to a token-based model, resulting in depleted quotas and unexpected charges for developers, leading to backlash and cancellations. Cursor issued refunds for unexpected usage charges and admitted they "missed the mark” on communication surrounding the changes after developers reported quickly burning through token quotas.

Samsara Launches New AI Tools for Physical Operations: Samsara introduced new AI-driven tools to enhance safety and efficiency in physical operations, including Multicam AI for safer driving, predictive maintenance to reduce downtime, and smart routing to avoid delays. With over 80% adoption of Samsara safety tech, the company positions itself as a leader in real-world AI solutions for frontline operations.

CJ ENM Pioneers AI-Generated Animated Series on YouTube: South Korean movie studio CJ ENM, known for films like 'Parasite,' is releasing 'Cat Biggie,' a fully AI-generated short animated series, on YouTube, utilizing its internal 'Cinematic AI' system. The company produced 30 two-minute episodes in five months with a team of six, compared to the typical 3-4 months for a 5-minute 3D animation, demonstrating the potential of AI in content creation.

Kyutai Labs Open-Sources Real-Time Text-to-Speech Model: Kyutai Labs, a European open science lab, has released Kyutai TTS, a text-to-speech model designed for fast, real-time use, along with a voice AI system called Unmute. The models are powered by delayed streams modeling (DSM) and are available for PyTorch, Rust, and MLX, facilitating the development of various consumer-friendly AI applications.

Amazon Deploys Millionth Robot and New Fleet Management Software: Amazon has deployed its millionth robot in its warehouses and has developed DeepFleet, a new software for managing robot movements. DeepFleet has reduced robot travel time by 10% by optimizing routes and reducing congestion, further automating the company's logistics infrastructure.

Dynamic Labs Releases Mirage, an AI-Native UGC Game Engine: Dynamic Labs introduced Mirage, a generative game engine that allows users to prompt the game with text to create new roads or delete enemies while playing. The engine uses a transformer-based autoregressive diffusion model trained on diverse game data and high-quality gameplay interactions, enabling live UGC gameplay.

Chai Achieves Zero-Shot Antibody Design with Chai-2 Model: AI startup Chai has developed Chai-2, an all-atom foundation model for general-purpose protein design that achieves a 16% hit rate in fully de novo antibody design, a 100-fold improvement over previous computational methods. The model, prompted to design antibodies to diverse targets, finds at least one successful hit for 50% of targets in a single round of experimental testing.

Google Brings 'Gemini Gems' to Workspace Apps: Google introduced custom and pre-built "Gems" chatbots within the Workspace side panel, enabling staff to summon role-specific AI helpers in Docs, Sheets, and Gmail. Users can now leverage AI without needing to add new vendors, as Gems live where employees already work, easing adoption and potentially increasing productivity gains. The company is bundling these bots at no added cost.

Yidu Tech Partners for Healthcare Analytics: Chinese teams are partnering with specialists like Yidu Tech in healthcare analytics to build AI tools tailored to specific industry needs, focusing on delivering tangible benefits rather than abstract AGI development. This contrasts with the US approach of pouring resources into larger language models.

Squirrel AI Develops Adaptive Learning Tools: Squirrel AI is partnering with Chinese teams to develop adaptive learning tools tailored to the needs of the education industry, focusing on delivering tangible benefits rather than abstract AGI development. This is part of a broader Chinese strategy to focus on economic and industrial AI applications.

DeepSeek Attracts Interest with Cost-Effective AI Model: DeepSeek, a Chinese AI model that is claimed to be seventeen times cheaper to run than its US counterparts, has attracted interest from budget-conscious buyers in Chile and Brazil. However, the company's highly anticipated R2 model has faced delays due to hardware shortages.

Meta Establishes Superintelligence Labs (MSL): Meta has launched Meta Superintelligence Labs (MSL) to pursue artificial general intelligence, led by former Scale AI CEO Alexandr Wang. The team includes researchers from other companies, while notably sidelining Yann LeCun, Meta’s chief AI scientist, who has cautioned against over-reliance on transformer architectures.

Cloudflare Introduces 'Pay-Per-Crawl' for Publishers: Cloudflare is beta-testing a 'pay-per-crawl' service allowing publishers to charge a minimum of $0.01 for each page a crawler requests, aiming to help them recoup lost ad revenue due to LLM scraping. This is in response to significant declines in referral visits from Google and OpenAI.

Lovable Introduces Development and Production Environment Separation: Lovable, a no-code platform, now allows users to separate development and production environments to prevent breaking live apps during ongoing development. This includes creating separate GitHub branches and managing Supabase databases to isolate code and data modifications.

Scale AI Receives Significant Investment from Meta: Meta invested nearly $15 billion in Scale AI for a 49% stake, doubling the company's valuation to $29 billion. Scale AI's founder, Alexandr Wang, now leads Meta Superintelligence Labs, further solidifying the partnership.

Baidu Releases Ernie 4.5: Baidu has launched Ernie 4.5, the latest version of its flagship AI model. This release continues Baidu's efforts to enhance its AI capabilities.

Together AI Open Sources DeepSWE Coding Agent: Together AI has open-sourced DeepSWE, a coding agent based on the Qwen3 model. This release provides developers with a new tool for AI-assisted coding tasks.

Grammarly Acquires AI Email Client Superhuman: Grammarly has acquired Superhuman, an AI email client, to integrate AI writing tools with the premium email experience. This aims to enhance communication productivity for users of both platforms.

O3's Financial Report Hallucination: According to a report by Axios, O3's AI model generated a financial report that blended truth and fabricated information, which could not be independently verified. This incident highlights the risks of using AI in generating financial documents and the importance of human oversight.

Google Brings Gemini CLI to Developers' Terminals: Google is introducing Gemini CLI, allowing developers to directly integrate and utilize Gemini's AI capabilities within their terminal environments. This move aims to streamline AI development workflows and provide developers with more direct access to Google's AI models.

Anthropic Enables App Creation Directly Within Claude AI Chatbot: Anthropic is now offering users the ability to develop applications directly from within its Claude AI chatbot interface. This new feature simplifies app development, making it more accessible to users without extensive coding experience.

Thinking Machines Lab Secures $2 Billion Seed Round: Mira Murati's Thinking Machines Lab successfully closed a $2 billion seed round, achieving a valuation of $10 billion. The funding will likely be used to further develop and scale their AI research and development efforts.

Meta Hires Key OpenAI Researcher for AI Reasoning Models: Meta has recruited a key researcher from OpenAI to contribute to its AI reasoning model development. This strategic hire signals Meta's commitment to advancing its capabilities in AI reasoning and potentially compete more directly with OpenAI in this field.

DeepMind Introduces AlphaGenome for Genomic Research: DeepMind has unveiled AlphaGenome, a new AI model designed to advance genomic research by predicting gene functions. This model is comparable to AlphaFold, but specifically focuses on understanding the roles of genes, promising significant advancements in the field of genomics.

Huawei Matebook Uses SMIC 7nm Chip: Huawei's Matebook laptop contains the Kirin X90 chip, which utilizes SMIC's 7nm (N+2) technology. This indicates progress in domestic chip manufacturing capabilities in China, despite international trade restrictions.

AMD Deploys Ultra Ethernet Ready Network Card: AMD has released its first Ultra Ethernet-ready network card, the Pensando Pollara, providing up to 400 Gbps performance. This deployment is a significant step in enhancing network infrastructure for high-bandwidth applications and data centers.

Nvidia Backs TerraPower's Nuclear Reactor Project: Nvidia has joined Bill Gates in supporting TerraPower, a company focused on building nuclear reactors to power data centers. This investment highlights the increasing demand for energy to support AI workloads and the exploration of nuclear energy as a sustainable solution.

Getty Drops Key Copyright Claims Against Stability AI: Getty Images has dropped key copyright claims against Stability AI, but the UK lawsuit continues. This development has significant implications for the legal landscape surrounding AI-generated content and the use of copyrighted material in AI training.

Meta Establishes 'Meta Superintelligence Labs' and Hires AI Talent: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg announced the creation of 'Meta Superintelligence Labs', leading all AI efforts within the company. Former Scale AI CEO Alexandr Wang will lead the group, assisted by former GitHub CEO Nat Friedman, with 11 new AI hires from Anthropic, Google DeepMind, and OpenAI. This aggressive recruitment aims to bolster Meta's AI capabilities, with reported eight-figure offers to attract top talent.

DeepMind Launches AlphaGenome for Gene Regulation Prediction: DeepMind introduced AlphaGenome, a model designed to predict gene regulation from DNA sequences, expanding beyond protein-folding with AlphaFold. This model uses deep learning to interpret the complex functional landscape of DNA, aiming for applications in therapeutic development. The company is pursuing multiple metrics to evaluate the success of the model due to the ambiguity of the field.

Google Releases Gemini CLI for Developers: Google launched Gemini CLI, an open-source AI agent that brings Gemini's coding, content generation, and research capabilities to developers' terminals. The tool enhances command line experiences and allows developers to use natural language prompts for coding tasks, integrated with Gemini Code Assist and Google Search. Gemini CLI is available for free preview with a Gemini Code Assist license, allowing 60 model requests per minute and 1,000 requests per day.

Baidu Open-Sources ERNIE 4.5 Model Family: Baidu is open-sourcing its ERNIE 4.5 model family under the Apache 2.0 license, seeking to foster global AI development and challenge industry norms set by companies like OpenAI and Anthropic. The release includes 10 variants with multimodal reasoning capabilities, outperforming DeepSeek V3 on 22 benchmarks at half the size.

Runway to Enable Video Game Generation with AI: Runway is expanding its generative AI technology from Hollywood to the gaming industry, with the goal of accelerating game development. The company is engaging in discussions with gaming companies to explore collaborations and secure data access for training their AI models, aiming to simplify the game creation process.

OpenAI Uses Google's AI Chips to Power Products: OpenAI has started renting Google's tensor processing units (TPUs) to power its products, diversifying its hardware sources beyond Nvidia GPUs and Microsoft's data centers. This move signals a partnership expansion between OpenAI and Google, supporting Google's cloud business by offering its AI technology to external customers.

Alibaba Unveils Qwen VLo AI Service for Image Generation: Alibaba introduced Qwen VLo, a new AI service that enhances user experience by enabling text-to-image and image-to-image generation. The service includes a progressive creation feature, which aims to improve the quality and control of generated images for users on the Alibaba platform.

Cursor Introduces Web and Mobile Agents for Code Development: Cursor released Progressive Web App support, extending its coding agent beyond the IDE to enable native-like experiences on mobile devices. Developers can now launch and monitor coding tasks like bug fixes and feature development from any browser or mobile device, accessing features via desktop, tablet, or mobile.

Anthropic Enables App Creation Within Claude AI Chatbot: Anthropic added a beta feature to its Claude AI chatbot, allowing users to create and share AI-powered apps directly within the platform. This functionality leverages the Artifacts feature for interactive development and API integration, enabling users to create custom AI applications without extensive coding.

Google Expands Veo 3 Access to Gemini App Pro Subscribers Globally: Google is expanding access to its Veo 3 Fast video generation model to all Gemini app 'Pro' subscribers worldwide, enabling video creation with limited daily prompts. Although available globally, reports indicate regional inconsistencies in access and features for equivalent subscription fees, with users in some areas lacking full access or only having Veo 2.

Meta Appoints Scale AI CEO as Chief AI Officer After Partial Acquisition: Meta hired Scale AI CEO Alexandr Wang as its new Chief AI Officer to lead its superintelligence research efforts. In a related move, Meta acquired a 49% non-voting stake in Scale AI for $14.3 billion, valuing the company at approximately $28 billion.

Together AI Prepares to Launch First NVIDIA GB200 Cluster: Together AI's first NVIDIA GB200 cluster, built by Dell, is preparing to go live, offering 1.4 exaflops of inference performance per rack. The new cluster aims to significantly improve the speed and efficiency of AI inference tasks for Together AI's users.

Perplexity to Introduce Veo 3 Video Generation for Max Subscribers: Perplexity plans to offer Veo 3 video generation capabilities to its Perplexity Max subscribers shortly. This addition will allow Perplexity Max users to generate high-quality video content directly within the Perplexity platform.

Hugging Face to Discontinue HuggingChat Service: Hugging Face announced that it will be shutting down its HuggingChat service, which served over a million users. The platform validated open-source models, demonstrating their potential and utility in real-world applications, prior to its closure.

K-Scale Labs Unveils Affordable Open-Source Humanoid Robot, K-Bot: K-Scale Labs introduced K-Bot, the first affordable, American-made, open-source humanoid robot, aiming to democratize robotics development. The company plans to make K-Bot accessible to hobbyists and researchers.

HelpingAI Releases Dhanishtha-2.0, Claims 'Intermediate Thinking' AI Model: HelpingAI open-sourced Dhanishtha-2.0, a model they claim to be the 'world's first intermediate thinking AI model,' available on Hugging Face. The model aims to reason in multiple steps before generating a final output, but its architecture and benchmarked performance are under scrutiny.

Apple Releases DiffuCoder-7B Coding Diffusion LLM: Apple released DiffuCoder-7B, a code generation LLM with base and instruct versions, on HuggingFace, which benchmarks comparably to other coding and diffusion models. Built as a finetuned Qwen2.5-Coder, the company has released technical details in their arXiv preprint.

DeepSeek R1T2 Model Released, Claiming 200% Speed Increase: DeepSeek released DeepSeek R1T2, claiming it to be 200% faster than R1-0528, while also outperforming it on GPQA & AIME 24 benchmarks. The model is available under an MIT license, broadening its accessibility for various applications.

Minimax-M1 Model Tops Math Leaderboard: MiniMax AI's open-source hybrid MoE model, MiniMax-M1, now holds the #1 position in math on the Text Arena leaderboard, also achieving #12 overall. The model's strong performance in math showcases its ability to handle complex reasoning tasks.

Huawei Open-Sources 72B MoE Model with MoGE Load Balancing: Huawei open-sourced its 72B MoE model, which features MoGE, an original load balancing solution. This release provides researchers and developers access to a sophisticated model with innovative load balancing capabilities.

Anthropic's Claude Runs a Month-Long Vending Store Experiment: Anthropic's Claude Sonnet 3.7 managed a vending store in their SF office for a month, handling tasks like inventory, pricing, and user messages using tools and Slack. Human workers only executed Claude's instructions, such as restocking. Claude used real-time web search to identify suppliers and even launched a 'Custom Concierge' service for pre-ordering unusual items, although it did struggle with business-specific reasoning and profitability.

Lambda Launches 1-Click GPU Clusters: Lambda has introduced 1-Click Clusters to enable users to deploy high-performance NVIDIA GPU clusters faster than standard cloud setups. This purpose-built infrastructure for GPU-heavy workloads offers flat pricing with no surprise egress or ingress fees and unified provisioning across compute, storage, and networking and features performance validation by ESG.

Google Launches Gemma 3n for On-Device Use: Google has launched Gemma 3n, an open-source model designed to run multimodal text, image, and audio tasks on-device with just 2GB of memory. This will allow for broader use of AI models directly on user devices without relying on cloud connectivity.

OpenAI Releases Deep Research API with MCP Support: OpenAI's Deep Research API now supports the Model Context Protocol (MCP), enabling users to pull private knowledge on demand. The API aims to facilitate the generation of structured, sourced reports by accessing and processing proprietary data.

Grammarly Acquires Superhuman for AI-Powered Email: Grammarly acquired Superhuman to integrate AI agents into user workflows, particularly email management.  The acquisition aims to combine Grammarly's writing assistance with Superhuman's AI-native email capabilities, enhancing user productivity.

Hugging Face Shuts Down HuggingChat: Hugging Face is closing down HuggingChat, which was launched in April 2023. During its run, HuggingChat served over a million users with the latest open-source models for free, as a 'brilliant experiment' to validate the capabilities of open-source LLMs.

Sakana AI Introduces AB-MCTS for Collective AI Intelligence: Sakana AI has released AB-MCTS (Adaptive Branching Monte Carlo Tree Search), a new inference-time scaling algorithm that enables multiple frontier models to cooperate. It uses models like Gemini 2.5 Pro, o4-mini, and DeepSeek-R1-0528 to collaborate and perform trial-and-error, significantly outperforming individual models on the ARC-AGI-2 benchmark.

Baidu Open-Sources ERNIE 4.5 VLM and LLMs: Baidu has released its ERNIE 4.5 models, reported to outperform DeepSeek v3 and Qwen 235B in vision-language tasks, and are competitive with OpenAI's O1. The open-source release aims to foster collaboration and innovation in the AI community.

Cloudflare Launches Pay-Per-Crawl AI Marketplace: Cloudflare is introducing a marketplace that allows website owners to charge AI bots for scraping their content. This initiative aims to provide publishers with greater control over their data and potentially create a new revenue stream from AI companies using their content for training purposes.

The Browser Company Pivots from Arc to Dia with AI Focus: The Browser Company, creator of Arc, shifted its focus to a new browser named Dia, which leverages AI to simplify internet tasks. Dia will make simple internet tasks easier with AI. Instead of switching between tabs to see which Airbnb is closest to the beach, you can ask Dia to check. Or, rather than jumping between the tabs you have open for research and Google Docs, you can tell Dia to draft a consolidated summary.

Tesla Launches Robotaxi Service in Austin, Texas: Tesla has initiated a small-scale Robotaxi service in Austin, Texas, using a fleet of 10-20 Model Y vehicles within a geofenced area. The rides, priced at $4.20, are currently available only to selected early-access users and are monitored by a Tesla employee in the passenger seat as a safety monitor, but with no driver, this represents a big leap forward.  However, initial reports indicate some issues with the autonomous system, including speed limit violations and unexpected maneuvers, and the company is being scrutinized by regulators for a lack of transparency.

Thinking Machines Lab Raises $2 Billion at $10 Billion Valuation: Thinking Machines Lab, an AI startup founded by Mira Murati, former CTO of OpenAI, has reportedly secured $2 billion in funding, reaching a valuation of $10 billion. This potential record-breaking seed round highlights investor confidence in the secretive startup's AI developments. Details about the company's specific focus are limited, but its high valuation signals significant expectations within the AI industry.

Apple Considers Acquiring or Partnering with Perplexity AI: Apple is reportedly in preliminary discussions to acquire or partner with Perplexity AI to bolster its AI capabilities. This move could potentially end Apple's search deal with Google and support the development of an AI-based search engine integrated into Safari and Siri. However, Apple faces competition from Samsung and Meta, who are also reportedly interested in collaborating with or acquiring Perplexity AI.

Google Fully Releases Gemma 3n Model with Multimodal Capabilities: Google has fully released Gemma 3n, a multimodal model from its Gemma family of open models, that natively supports image, audio, video, and text inputs and outputs. It incorporates the MatFormer architecture for compute flexibility, Per Layer Embeddings (PLE) for memory efficiency, and new audio and MobileNet-v5-based vision encoders optimized for on-device use cases. The model outperforms other models under 10 billion parameters, reaching an LMArena score of over 1300.

Google's Imagen 4 Now Available in Gemini API and Google AI Studio: Google's Imagen 4, a text-to-image model, is now available in paid preview via the Gemini API and for limited free testing in Google AI Studio, with general availability expected soon.  Alongside Imagen 4, Google has also released Imagen 4 Ultra, which is designed to produce outputs that are more closely aligned with text prompts. The model is designed to improve instruction-following capabilities and output quality compared to other leading image generation models.

Foxconn and Nvidia in Talks to Deploy Humanoid Robots at Houston Factory: Foxconn and Nvidia are reportedly in advanced discussions to deploy humanoid robots at Foxconn's new factory in Houston, where Nvidia's GB300 AI servers will be produced. The robots, possibly developed by Foxconn or UBTech, are expected to perform assembly and cable insertion tasks, with deployment targeted for early next year. This move signifies an increasing adoption of humanoid robots in manufacturing settings.

DeepMind Unveils AlphaGenome for Predicting Genetic Variation Effects: DeepMind has introduced AlphaGenome, an AI model capable of predicting how genetic variations in human DNA affect gene regulation.  By analyzing DNA sequences, AlphaGenome outperforms previous models and offers insights into genetic variants' effects, especially in non-coding regions linked to disease. The model is available for non-commercial research via API, and it is expected to accelerate advances in genomics, disease research, and synthetic biology.

Wix Acquires AI Startup Base44 for $80 Million: Wix acquired Base44, a six-month-old AI startup focused on "vibe-coding," for $80 million in cash. Base44 uses AI to generate code from simple user inputs, enabling the creation of software ideas with minimal coding knowledge.  The acquisition is expected to enhance Wix's website development capabilities by making website creation easier and more efficient.

OpenAI Developing Productivity Tools to Rival Microsoft and Google: OpenAI is reportedly developing new productivity tools for ChatGPT, including collaborative document editing and integrated chat features, to compete with Google Workspace and Microsoft Office.  These tools aim to make ChatGPT a comprehensive personal and workplace assistant, indicating OpenAI's expansion beyond language models into productivity software. Launch dates for these new features are yet to be announced.

Runway ML Launches Game Worlds for AI-Powered Video Game Creation: Runway ML launched Game Worlds, a browser-based platform enabling users to create text adventure games using AI. The platform generates visuals from narrative inputs, targeting creators aiming to prototype interactive stories without coding. Runway is exploring partnerships with studios to license game data for AI training and integrate its tools into professional game development pipelines.

Google's AI Summaries Impact News Traffic.: Google's AI summaries have reduced news traffic by 34%, impacting journalism revenue as readers opt for concise, free summaries over full articles and subscriptions; this compression of information is valuable, but may reduce the incentives to create longer form content.

Doppl Launches AI Video App.: Google Labs has launched Doppl, a new app that uses AI to turn photos of outfits into videos of the user wearing them; this app provides a virtual closet experience.

DeepMind's AlphaGenome Predicts Genetic Mutations.: DeepMind's AlphaGenome can analyze DNA sequences to identify potential disease-causing mutations in minutes, advancing diagnostic capabilities. The technology flags potential disease-causing mutations in minutes, and a benchtop prototype called NANOSPRESSO promises to print custom gene therapies before a nurse’s shift ends.

Meta and Anthropic Secure AI Training Copyright Ruling.: Meta and Anthropic have secured a court ruling indicating that training AI models on copyrighted books is considered fair use, provided the content is properly licensed or purchased; this decision gives firms that can afford licensing advantages over smaller AI startups.

Europe Approves Inne's Minilab Saliva-Based Contraceptive.: Inne's Minilab, the first saliva-based contraceptive, has been approved in Europe; this hormone-free device tracks progesterone levels to provide pill-level efficacy.

Tesla Launches Robotaxi Service in Austin.: Tesla has officially launched its robotaxi service in Austin, Texas, using Model Y vehicles with Full Self-Driving software and safety monitors. Future plans include purpose-built Cybercab sedans and Robovan vehicles designed without steering wheels or pedals.

ElevenLabs Releases Voice Assistant with Workflow Integration.: ElevenLabs has released 11.ai Voice Assistant, which integrates with tools like Linear, Slack, and Notion to complete real workflows; they also released Voice Design v3 for generating custom voices and a mobile app for on-the-go content creation.

Google DeepMind Unveils AlphaGenome for Genomic Analysis.: Google DeepMind has unveiled AlphaGenome, an AI model that analyzes up to 1 million DNA base pairs at single-base resolution to predict thousands of functional genomic tracks; it is now available via API for non-commercial research, to allow more precise results when analyzing the human genome.

Meta Pursues Funding for AI Data Centers.: Meta is seeking $29 billion from private capital firms to fund the construction of AI data centers in the U.S., demonstrating a large capital investment in sustained demand for compute infrastructure; the company is in talks with Apollo, KKR, Brookfield, Carlyle, and Pimco to raise roughly $3 billion in equity plus $26 billion in debt.

Neuralink's Brain-Computer Interface Advances.: Neuralink reported that seven paralyzed participants are using its brain-computer interface, Telepathy, to control devices through thought alone; the wireless implant records neural activity and converts intended movements into digital actions, which allows the users to regain digital autonomy.

Tencent Open-Sources Hunyuan-A13B MoE Model: Tencent has released Hunyuan-A13B, an 80B parameter Mixture-of-Experts (MoE) model with 13.5B active parameters, featuring a 256K context window and optimized for tool calling and coding. The model is competitive with models like Qwen-A22B and OpenAI's o1, boasting higher inference throughput due to its use of Mamba layers.

Google Releases Gemma 3n Multimodal Model: Google has launched Gemma 3n, a multimodal model supporting text, audio, image, and video, designed for edge devices and available in 2B and 4B parameter versions. The model is available across major frameworks like Transformers, vLLM, MLX, and Llama.cpp, fostering open-source collaboration.

Black Forest Labs Releases FLUX.1 Kontext Image AI Model: Black Forest Labs has released the weights for FLUX.1 Kontext [dev], an open image AI model, enabling fast endpoints on Hugging Face Inference Providers through services like fal and Replicate. The model has quickly gained over 20,000 followers on Hugging Face.

Inception AI Labs Launches Mercury Diffusion LLM: Inception AI Labs introduced Mercury, a diffusion LLM tailored for chat applications.  It is described as the first commercial-scale diffusion LLM and is touted for its ultra-fast performance.

Kyutai Labs Releases Open-Source Speech-to-Text Model: Kyutai Labs has launched a new open-source speech-to-text model, which ranks first among streaming models on the Open ASR Leaderboard. The model can run on devices like Macs and iPhones via MLX.

OpenAI Launches Deep Research API and Open-Sources Prompts: OpenAI has introduced Deep Research in its API, utilizing o3/o4-mini models, and has open-sourced the full prompts and methodology for its prompt rewriter. This allows developers to build agents with o3/o4-mini deep research quality, and includes details on multi-agent support with MCP, which has been integrated into LangChain and LangGraph.

Google's Gemini CLI Gains Rapid Adoption: The open-source Gemini CLI has rapidly gained over 30,000 GitHub stars, functioning as an AI agent for the terminal that assists with coding, debugging, and app generation. Its popularity reflects strong developer interest in Gemini models.

LlamaIndex Announces Native MCP Server on LlamaCloud: LlamaIndex announced LlamaCloud now features a native MCP (Multi-agent Communication Protocol) server. This allows users to connect their knowledge base in LlamaCloud to AI frontends like Claude, enabling document understanding with high accuracy in under 5 minutes and LlamaParse's automated form parsing feature provides general form understanding without training.

Microsoft Mandates AI Tool Usage for Employees: Microsoft has issued an internal memo stating that the use of GitHub Copilot and other AI tools is now mandatory for all employees. This signifies a shift from optional pilot programs to required workflows, indicating a company-wide AI-first approach.

Superframe to Launch 100,000 AI Startups Annually: South Park Commons-backed Superframe claims its AI studio can spin up 100,000 micro-companies every year by mixing LLMs, no-code ops, and pre-seed capital.  This would accelerate the formation of new AI-driven businesses and potential M&A activity.

OpenAI Launches Deep Research API with Webhooks: OpenAI released its Deep Research API for both o3-deep-research and o4-mini models, enabling developers to build applications that leverage deep research capabilities. This release includes the addition of long-awaited webhook support, allowing real-time event notifications, streamlining automation workflows, and improving integration capabilities.

Google Releases Gemma 3n, a Multimodal AI Model for Edge Devices: Google released Gemma 3n, a multimodal AI model supporting audio, video, image, and text inputs, designed to run efficiently on edge devices with as little as 2GB of RAM. Key features include parameter-efficient variants, a new audio encoder, integration with MobileNetV5, and extensive compatibility across platforms, allowing developers to implement powerful AI features directly on mobile devices.

Black Forest Labs Releases FLUX.1 Kontext [dev] for Image Editing: Black Forest Labs released FLUX.1 Kontext [dev], an open-weights image editing model with performance comparable to proprietary solutions, available on Hugging Face. The model is a 12B parameter rectified flow transformer intended to facilitate advanced image editing workflows and has immediate support in diffusers and Chipmunk.

Suno Acquires AI-Powered DAW WavTool: Suno, known for AI music generation, acquired WavTool, an AI-powered digital audio workstation, with the intention of providing artists with more precise creative control in their workflows. This acquisition merges AI music generation capabilities with an AI-driven professional audio editing environment.

Anthropic Enables App Creation with Claude: Anthropic now allows users to create and share functional, AI-powered applications with Claude's intelligence directly embedded within them, enabling shareable, interactive experiences. This allows the creation of shareable, interactive experiences.

Meta Hires Key Researchers from OpenAI's Zurich Office: Meta recruited prominent researchers from OpenAI's Zurich office, including Lucas Beyer, Alexander Kolesnikov, and Xiaohua Zhai, for Meta's superintelligence projects, plus Trapit Bansal, a key contributor to OpenAI's o1 reasoning model. This talent acquisition aims to bolster Meta's AI research efforts in developing more advanced reasoning models.

Google's Doppl App Lets Users Try on Clothes Virtually: Google Labs launched Doppl, an application that allows users to upload a photo of themselves and virtually try on outfits. The app generates a video of the user wearing the selected outfit, enabling them to visualize how they look in different clothing combinations.

xAI's Grok to get advanced code editor: xAI's Grok is getting an advanced code editor that lets users run code inside Grok, enabling code modification and debugging, offering a visual interface to code generation and manipulation within the platform.

Meta acquires AI voice-cloning startup Play AI: Meta is reportedly in talks to acquire Play AI, a startup specializing in voice cloning technology, to enable realistic voice generation for AI-powered apps and conversational experiences. The acquisition is aimed at allowing Meta's chatbots to have personalized voices.

Pearson Partners with Google Cloud to Integrate AI into K-12 Education: Pearson has partnered with Google Cloud to integrate AI-driven tools into K-12 products, providing personalized lesson plans, real-time performance dashboards, and automated content suggestions. This multi-year deal aims to enhance the educational experience by leveraging Google's AI models to create more adaptive and engaging learning environments.

Anthropic Partially Wins Copyright Case Over AI Model Training: A federal court ruled that Anthropic's use of copyrighted books to train its LLMs may qualify as fair use, but its acquisition and storage of pirated copies does not. This decision, in a lawsuit filed by authors, divides Anthropic's actions into permissible fair use for training purposes and impermissible use for building a pirated library.

Google Updates Gemini AI Family with Gemini 2.5 Pro and Flash-Lite: Google announced the general availability of Gemini 2.5 Pro and a preview of Gemini 2.5 Pro Flash-Lite, a cost-effective model for high-volume AI workloads. The Flash-Lite model offers significantly reduced costs for both input and output tokens compared to the 2.5 Flash model.

MiniMax M1 Model Claims Top Spot Among Chinese LLMs: Shanghai-based MiniMax launched MiniMax-M1, an open-source reasoning model that the company claims surpasses domestic closed-source models in China and rivals leading overseas models like OpenAI and Google. The model has a one million token context window and the company touts its cost-effectiveness due to its efficient Lightning Attention mechanism.

Tesla Begins Limited Robotaxi Service in Austin: Tesla has started a limited self-driving taxi service, Robotaxi, in Austin, Texas, available to select guests on certain streets with safety monitors present. While the vehicles are not operational in adverse weather conditions, this marks the initial phase of Elon Musk's plan for widespread autonomous ride-hailing.

Tensions Rise Between OpenAI and Microsoft Over AI Partnership: OpenAI is seeking to renegotiate its AI partnership with Microsoft, aiming to reduce Microsoft's control and gain approval for its shift to a for-profit public-benefit corporation to raise $20 billion in funding. Disputes center around intellectual property access, including OpenAI's Windsurf acquisition, and future ownership stakes, with OpenAI exploring alternative cloud providers.

Midjourney Launches V1 AI Video Generation Model: Midjourney released its first AI video generation model, V1, enabling users to create short, customizable videos from images. This move positions Midjourney to compete in the AI video space, although the company is already facing legal challenges over copyright issues.

Google Releases Gemini Robotics On-Device Model: Google introduced the Gemini Robotics On-Device model, enabling robots to execute tasks locally without internet connectivity and to adapt to different robot types using natural language prompts. This demonstration includes capabilities such as unzipping bags and folding clothes.

OpenAI Wins $200 Million U.S. Defense Contract: OpenAI secured a $200 million contract with the U.S. Defense Department to develop AI tools for national security under its new OpenAI for Government initiative. The project involves collaboration with defense technology startup Anduril.

Meta Invests Heavily in Scale AI: Meta Platforms is infusing $14.3 billion into Scale AI, a data-labeling startup, and hiring key leadership to enhance its AI capabilities. The deal effectively doubles Scale AI's valuation and raises concerns of potential client shifts at the startup.

Anthropic Adds App-Building Capabilities to Claude: Anthropic is upgrading its Claude model with new app-building features, enabling users to create, host, and share interactive AI-powered apps directly from text prompts. This update allows users to build functioning tools and eliminates the need for creators to manage API keys, shifting costs to end-users.

Anthropic Wins 'Fair Use' Ruling, Faces Trial for Pirated Books: A federal judge ruled that Anthropic's AI training on legally purchased books is fair use, allowing Claude to learn from them without directly copying. However, the judge also stated that Anthropic will face trial for copyright infringement due to the use of millions of pirated books in its training data, potentially leading to significant damages.

Replit Achieves $100M ARR, Demonstrating Rapid Growth: Replit, a collaborative coding platform, has announced that it has surpassed $100 million in annual recurring revenue (ARR), a substantial increase from $10 million at the end of 2024. This growth highlights Replit's increasing adoption among developers and its success in providing a cloud-based coding environment.

Delphi Raises $16M Series A to Scale Human Expertise with Digital Minds: Delphi, a platform enabling the creation of 'digital minds' to scale human expertise, has secured $16 million in a Series A funding round led by Sequoia. With over 2,000 digital minds already created, Delphi aims to make human knowledge more accessible and discoverable through its platform.
